page.title: 01King's Cliffe & Land to NE
page.content: King's Cliffe is an ancient village with many old stone-walled and stone-stated houses, dating back three or four hundred years, as well as about 20 private houses and 60 council houses built in the last 40 years. The centre of the village is a conservation area. The surrounding countryside has low hills and considerable tracts of forest land, together with farms, arable and pasture land. There are th remains of stone and gravel qurries. About 1000 people live in the village which acts as a rural centre for about 12 other villages. It has a Co-op shop, butcher, baker and other shops, doctor's surgery, garage, post-office, primary & middle school, village hall, churches, clubs and other organisations. People work in agriculture, transport (lorries),
